An explanation of how and when the custo: An explanation of how and when the customer was shown or provided with your refund policy prior to purchase.
Your refund policy, as shown or provided: Your refund policy, as shown or provided to the customer.
Any communication with the customer that: Any communication with the customer that you feel is relevant to your case (e.g. emails proving that they received the product or service or demonstrating their use of or satisfaction with the product or service).
Any receipt or message sent to the custo: Any receipt or message sent to the customer notifying them of the charge. This field will be filled automatically with a Stripe generated email receipt if any such receipt was sent.
A relevant document or contract showing: A relevant document or contract showing the customer's signature (if available).
Provide any extra evidence or statements: Provide any extra evidence or statements you'd like the bank to see, either as text or by uploading a document.
Documentation showing proof that a servi: Documentation showing proof that a service was provided to the cardholder. This could include a copy of a signed contract, work order or other form of written agreement.
The date on which the cardholder receive: The date on which the cardholder received or began receiving the purchased service.
Any server or activity logs showing proo: Any server or activity logs showing proof that the cardholder accessed or downloaded the purchased digital product. This information should include IP addresses, corresponding timestamps and any detailed recorded activity.
\u2022 Evidence that the same device and: • Evidence that the same device and card used in the disputed payment was used in a previous payment which was not disputed
\u2022 Evidence that your website or app: • Evidence that your website or app was accessed by the cardholder for purchase or services on or after the transaction date
\u2022 Evidence that the customer logged: • Evidence that the customer logged into their account for your business before the transaction date
\u2022 Customer name and email address l: • Customer name and email address linked to their customer profile
\u2022 Device ID and name of the device: • Device ID and name of the device
\u2022 Customer's IP address and their d: • Customer's IP address and their device's geographical location at the time of purchase
Provide at least two of the following pi: Provide at least two of the following pieces of information:
A justification for why the customer's s: A justification for why the customer's subscription was not cancelled.
An explanation of how and when the custo: An explanation of how and when the customer was shown your cancellation policy prior to purchase.
Your subscription cancellation policy, a: Your subscription cancellation policy, as shown to the customer.
A description of the product or service: A description of the product or service and any relevant details on how this was presented to the customer at the time of purchase.
The address to which a physical product: The address to which a physical product was despatched. The delivery address must match a billing address verified with AVS. (A signature is not required as evidence of delivery).
The date on which a physical product beg: The date on which a physical product began its route to the delivery address. This date should be prior to the date of the dispute.
Provide documentation as proof that a pr: Provide documentation as proof that a product was despatched to the cardholder at the same address the cardholder provided to you. This could include a copy of the delivery receipt or label showing the full delivery address of the cardholder, if possible.
The tracking number (if available) for a: The tracking number (if available) for a physical product obtained from the delivery service. If multiple tracking numbers were generated for this purchase, please separate them with commas. When we compile your evidence into a single document, these tracking numbers will be expanded to include detailed delivery information from the carrier.
The delivery service that shipped a phys: The delivery service used to deliver a physical product, such as Fedex, UPS, USPS, etc. If multiple carriers were used for this purchase, please separate them with commas.
A copy of a service agreement or documen: A copy of a service agreement or documentation for the disputed payment.
A shipping label or receipt for the disp: A delivery label or receipt for the disputed payment.
Upload documentation for the prior payme: Upload documentation for the prior payment which identifies it uniquely, such as a separate receipt. This document should be paired with a similar document from the disputed payment which proves that the two are separate. This should also include a separate delivery label or receipt for the other payment. If multiple products were despatched together, provide a packing list which shows each purchase.
Provide general evidence about the custo: Provide general evidence about the customer and the order.
An explanation of the difference between: An explanation of the difference between the disputed payment and the prior one which appears to be a duplicate.
The charge ID for the previous payment t: The charge ID for the previous payment which appears to be a duplicate of the one that is disputed.
Your explanation for why the customer is: Your explanation for why the customer is not entitled to a refund.
